intro: Spergularia bungeana, commonly known as the Bunge's sandspurry, is a flowering plant species native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and produces small, pink or white flowers. Its leaves are typically succulent, adapted to conserve water in dry environments. Spergularia bungeana is often found in sandy or gravelly soils, thriving in conditions where other plants struggle to grow.
